definition: on this (occasion)/at this time when .../on this occasion
value/(to be) worth/to happen to/to be on duty

sentences.english: At this festive occasion, wish business was flourishing.
sentences.chinese: 值此佳节之际，恭祝事业蒸蒸日上。

sentences.english: To all of them we pay tribute on the occasion of the 2010 World Meteorological Day.
sentences.chinese: 值此2010年世界气象日之际，我们谨向他们致敬。

sentences.english: On the occasion of the Spring Festival, good business.
sentences.chinese: 值此新春佳节之际，恭祝事业蒸蒸日上。

sentences.english: On the occasion of the 35th anniversary of your National Day, please accept our heartiest congratulations.
sentences.chinese: 值此国庆三十五周年之际，请接受我们最真诚的祝贺。

sentences.english: May every happiness be yours on this wedding.
sentences.chinese: 值此婚礼佳期，祝你幸福无比。

sentences.english: May every happiness be yours on this Wedding Day.
sentences.chinese: 值此婚礼佳期，祝你幸福无量。

sentences.english: Please accept my best regards on this happy occasion.
sentences.chinese: 值此佳节之际，谨致问候之意。

sentences.english: Now, at my 80th birthday, I salute them again.
sentences.chinese: 值此八十贱辰，我再度向他们致敬。

definition: to just happen to coincide with
to be about to arrive/to be around the corner
just at that time/as it happens/by good luck, just then
(formal) birthday/anniversary of the founding of an organization
(in the spring) nature takes on a new look (idiom)
just at the time of/honest/upright/(math.) positive value
